title: Calories in a Dave's Double Burger
meta_description: Discover calories in a daves double from Wendy's, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for your meal.
h1: Calories in a Dave's Double Burger
assumptions: Standard Wendy's Dave's Double: two quarter-pound beef patties, American cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickles, onions, ketchup, mayo, sesame seed bun; no customizations.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, and custom orders. Values based on standard U.S. Wendy's data; check app or menu for latest.

quick_answer.text: A Dave's Double burger has ~860 kcal, with 51 g protein and 51 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Dave's Double?
faqs.a: Approximately 860 kcal for the standard version.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Dave's Double?
faqs.a: About 51 g of protein from the beef patties and cheese.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a Dave's Double?
faqs.a: Yes, around 51 g total, mostly from the bun and condiments.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a Dave's Double?
faqs.a: Roughly 1440 mg, so watch intake if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: Can I make a Dave's Double lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes—skip the bun or cheese to reduce by 70–240 kcal.
